Insulation: The use of insulation materials can help keep the room cool in the summer and warm during the winter. Thick curtains, blinds, and rugs can help reduce heat transfer and retain indoor temperature.
Hydration: Drink plenty of water and other cold beverages to help keep you cool, and also take advantage of the cooling effect of sweat.
Use of Cooling Gels and Towels: Apply cooling gels, towels, or clothing to your body to help regulate your temperature.
Build a Small Cooling Tower: Create a simple, portable cooling tower by placing trays of water in front of a fan to lower the temperature of the air.
Wear Light-colored Clothes: Light-colored clothing reflects light and heat, keeping you cooler.
